content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												8/10, one of the most immersive RPG games I have played, with a shocking and nice storyline which gets you right in the action and fulfills the dreams of every guy who is bored with civilization and wants to become a dropout!The negative aspects are tha there is no way to actually view your character (who seems to possess no feet!) and thus the equipment upgrades have no visual impact. The weapon choices are a bit limited for each of the two phases of the game when you get to unlock new weapons, although those available are fully and realistically customizable. The non realistic component is the healing system, which showcases 1st aid and self crafted syringes capable of (in later level and the corresponding skills) almost fully heal you amidst a hail of bulets in a matter of like 2 seconds.Aside from that the game boasts excellent graphics, very good characters and voice acting, a good variety of side quests and achievements (the achievements are shown on Uplay, and extra program you install together with FC3) as well as a variety of rewards and extra content that can be unlocked for free by spending points you get while playing the game. Aside from questing, you are fully able to explore around the two available islands, make little safaris and pursue some extra adrenaline with activities like paragliding, base jumping etc (I even flew on a paraglider from one island to another just for the sake of it xD) !

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Sucks.Let me specify. Poorly optimized. Runs like♥♥♥♥♥♥ Couldn't caliberate it to a 1600 dpi mouse. Gunplay sucks. Stealth is a ♥♥♥♥ing joke. Sound design is weaker than necessary for game that's main mechanic is jungle survival. Overall, just sucks.What's worse is that I liked Blood Dragon more! In retrospect, the only things I hated about Blood Dragon were the setting (as a 90's child, I ♥♥♥♥ing hate the 80's), and the visuals of it. The game ran a hell of a lot better, the controls were tighter, and gameplay was all-around, actually fun.So ya. This game sucks.Weeks later: So, I still find the game boring as hell. However, a random recollection of a random comment by some game production moggle came to mind: the suggestion that if PC gamers would accept the 720 resolutions, they could guarantee 60 fps. I initially assumed this was a lazy programmer trying to take pot shots at the PC community, as is often the case. However, upon remembering this statement, I was tempted to retry Far Cry 3 in 720p. To my surprise, without even activating the fan on my GPU, I am able to run the game at the highest possible settings with well over 60 fps. Is this good: no. For the fact that, just before I ran this test, I was playing Skyrim, a similar graphical powerhouse at full capacity at 1080p. At 720, yeah it may be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of graphical presentation, but what good is it  to do so only effectively at 720p for most (non Titan and similar high-end) machines; it still looks bad. Especially when a rival and fairly contemporary game runs beautifully at 1080p at 60 fps. So still, don't bother, but if you are compelled and run into issues, try it at 720i or 720p.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												3 out of 5.  Fun, beautiful / repetitive, derivative.  The first few hours of the game were a blast to play.  In the beginning there are serious limitations to how many weapons, and how much ammunition you carry.  As a result I spent several boring hours hunting animals to make larger bags and whatnot, fun the first time, boring the tenth time.  Even after I was fully upgraded I still felt like I couldn't carry enough ammo to play the way I wanted to.  The story is alright, and the island is relatively fun to explore.  Many of the side missions are unoriginal, and the way you unlock parts of the map by capturing towers is soooo unoriginal and a chore.  I feel like the creators had a good game, then added boring filler (hunting, side missions, towers) to increase the play time.  You can ignore these parts of the game, but then your character will be weak in the late-game.  None of the vehicles were as fun as they should have been, mainly due to poor controls and poor physics.  I really wish I liked this game more.  I recommend playing it, but get it I on sale like me.  The guns are pretty good, and I loved how you could customize most of them.  I wish there were more customizations.  I didn't hate this game, but I didn't love it, I wish there was a sliding scare or a 5 star rating system instead of a thumbs up or down.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												Farcry 3 is a choose-your-own way open world shooter. The stealth is pretty simple and sometimes the AI is pretty dumb, However you can certainly play through the whole game as either a stealthy assassin or maniac with a shotgun. The game does shine in freedom of choice in the murdering department. Many of the weapons and vehicles are quite fun. In addition to the storyline missions there is a lot of collecting and upgrades to find. Unfortunely these are pretty basic and repetitive after the tenth time.  Character development has a few options, but by the end of the game you will pretty much have every skill anyhow. The story is pretty loose. You play a typical dude-bro rich kid who ends up stranded on an island with some less than reputable denizens. Without spoilers the first third or so is actually pretty good, but really falls off the rails hard and fast after that. The two avialable conclusions are downright stupid. Until it was patched, you couldnt even continue the game after the last mission, you had to restart all over.It definately yells straight console port, which isnt bad in itself, but while everything ran fine it did pull on my system way more than it should have.  Other than that it looks great. Forced Uplay added junk is not fun.The DLC is forgettable. A few unique weapons that dont change much and a couple ok side missions.Sale Buy. 6.5/10

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												Far Cry 3 is a great game that offers a great storyline with fun game play. The mechanics in this game are not the greatest but the takedown mechanics are very fun and enjoyable because who dosen't enjoy stabing someone and throwing a knife at the next enemy? The hunting is satisfying because it serves a purpose by allowing the player to hold more money, more ammo, more C4, more carrying capacity, and more syringes; because drugs are your friend in this game. Finding loot and collectibles are good adding more hours of gameplay and playing poker fun as well giving players choices in difficulty that changes the price to buy in. The only gripes I have with this game are with some skills not being very useful, money being limited, limited encounters with certain animals, not being able to experience co-op because not a lot of people use Uplay, and Uplay. I recommend this game because it's fun, enjoyable, satisfying, and you get to enjoy being on drugs!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												Did I ever tell you the definition of insanity?In the beginning of the game, I found myself hiding from the pirates and avoiding confrontation because I didn't know the island, the weapons, or the enemy. As the game progressed, I found myself actively seeking and engaging the pirates more and more, and using the foliage and the jungle to my advantage. After finishing the game and realizing that the islands, the jungle, and Vaas, which all tore apart Jason's sanity, made me a little more like Vaas.I became more sadistic, psychopathic, and ruthless to my enemies in the game.I used violence to end violence, but it only created a more violent me. The victim became the abuser. The game itself is a mind blowing experience, the graphics, the details, the soundtrack, the gameplay, the immersive story, it all fits in together so perfect it makes this one of the best games I have ever played. Literally.Your character develops his sociopathic traits as the game progresses, accepting violence instead of refusing it, eventually admitting he enjoys killing just for the bloodlust, turning himself into the reckless, sadistic and cynical man he once feared. Have I ever told you the definition of insanity?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Sucks.Let me specify. Poorly optimized. Runs like♥♥♥♥♥♥ Couldn't caliberate it to a 1600 dpi mouse. Gunplay sucks. Stealth is a ♥♥♥♥ing joke. Sound design is weaker than necessary for game that's main mechanic is jungle survival. Overall, just sucks.What's worse is that I liked Blood Dragon more! In retrospect, the only things I hated about Blood Dragon were the setting (as a 90's child, I ♥♥♥♥ing hate the 80's), and the visuals of it. The game ran a hell of a lot better, the controls were tighter, and gameplay was all-around, actually fun.So ya. This game sucks.Weeks later: So, I still find the game boring as hell. However, a random recollection of a random comment by some game production moggle came to mind: the suggestion that if PC gamers would accept the 720 resolutions, they could guarantee 60 fps. I initially assumed this was a lazy programmer trying to take pot shots at the PC community, as is often the case. However, upon remembering this statement, I was tempted to retry Far Cry 3 in 720p. To my surprise, without even activating the fan on my GPU, I am able to run the game at the highest possible settings with well over 60 fps. Is this good: no. For the fact that, just before I ran this test, I was playing Skyrim, a similar graphical powerhouse at full capacity at 1080p. At 720, yeah it may be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of graphical presentation, but what good is it  to do so only effectively at 720p for most (non Titan and similar high-end) machines; it still looks bad. Especially when a rival and fairly contemporary game runs beautifully at 1080p at 60 fps. So still, don't bother, but if you are compelled and run into issues, try it at 720i or 720p.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
												To begin with, it's only fair to say that there are things to not like about Far Cry 3. By no means is this a perfect game, nor is it a groundbreaking game. That, however, does not stop it from being a great game and a superb way to waste away many hours of your life.I'll try to break this review down into several main categories, namely: graphics and visual effects, sound, story/characters, gameplay and overall feel. Here we go:Graphics and visual effectsEven now, after more than 3 years since the release, the game looks great. There are games that will gve you better graphics, better effects, better physics but what the player gets in FC3 is more than enough. The game setting is amazing, the jungle, water, sky, beaches - it all looks beautiful and, most importantly, rather realistic. All the animations are solid and there were really no eyesores throughout the game. Really good effort! All things you see close-up, like faces of NPCs, gun textures and so on are just lovely.One thing the game kind of lacks in is a proper physics engine that would let you destroy at least some elements of the environment. As things are, even wooden boxes are impervious to an RPG-7 round. Good thing is that at least fire spreads nicely, after you use a Molotov cocktail of a flamethrower.SoundNo complaints here either. The ambient noises of the islands and their wildlife lets the player really sink in the game. The weapons have nice, juicy sounds that almost let you feel their punch. The voice-over is also good, the voices match their characters and don't feel out-of-place. The only complaint is the repetetiveness of 'catchphrases' of the NPCs. Hearing 'It was all me!' was worse than the arrow-in-the-knee bit from Skyrim... The music featured some nice bits (especially during the mission where you light up a whole plantation of weed was spot on! As for the engine noises of the vehicles available... well they're there and that's it.Story/ charactersThe story is rather good, actually. I didn't expect much and was pleasantly surprised. The protagonist and his friends are nicely thrown into the game and some of their stories (the bits that happen during the game, not their background, that's just mediocre) really made some impact on me. Especially the bloke the player rescues from Buck. That was just sick (but good for the story!). Of course, if you've seen any materials about FC3, you know that the highlight is the antagonist, who really wins the whole game, as far as the story and characters are concerned. Vaas is just an axcellent character and even his backstory is worth paying attention to.GameplayAt first, satisfying and a little challenging, later got repetetive and too easy. First annoying thing about it was the crafting system. It's great that it's there and I like how it encourages the player to venture off the beaten track to hunt for animals. However, honestly without crafting at least 6 items the game just gets on your nerves. Unless you craft a holster, you can only have one weapon, the numer of carred ammo is prepostrously low, your inventory is always full and so is your wallet. I know, Jason is just a tourist at the beginning but even so, he could surely manage to carry both a pistol and a bow at the same time. I ended up ditching all main story missions and spent several hours hunting just to get rid of these nuisances. As for exploration and combat, there is not much to complain about - it's satisfying and fun. Somewhere around 75% of the main story you can acquire some skills thatk make you a bit overpowered, with the 'chained takedown' being a prime example, but most importantly it did not get boring. A great plus here is setting the game in an open world, where animals, especially predators can provde some really unexpected twists to the gameplay.Overall feel and the verdictOverall feel was very positive. There was hardly a moment when I felt that the producers took shortcuts and ran out of ideas. The game did not feel like it was trying too hard to be something it's not. It felt like a really well crafted product.And that's what Far Cry 3 is, in essence. A very well-made, solid game certain to bring the player hours of fun, without trying to fool you nto thinking that it's a new milestone in video games design. The game world is very well designed, the gameplay mechanics are satisfying, there is no unnecessary drama, there are some excellent characters and story elements. The audiovisual aspects leave very little room for complaining, even more than three years since the release.Would I play it again? Probably no. If I want more of Far Cry 3, I can always play Far Cry 4 (which is what I'm doing now, incidentally). However, would I recommend it to someone who has never tried it? Oh yes. Most certainly yes!And finally, for some pros and cons list:PROSgraphicsaudiosatisfying, in the long run, gameplayhuge map, great settingthe antagonistsurprisingly good storybig arsenalvery good optimisation and hardly any bugsCONSforced crafting systemsome secondary charactersrepetitivenessuneven difficulty levellacking physics engineA score, on a 10-point scale for Far Cry 3 would be a solid 9. As I wrote before, it may not be a revolution but it surely delivers on what it is.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Coming from recently playing Just Cause 2, I didn't expect the length of this campaign. Especially if you take the time to do side quests, DLC missions, and take over all the outposts and radio towers. This game is fantastic. You can run around and go in guns blazing, or you can sneak up and take everyone out quietly with silenced weapons or the bow. However, my favorite way to play is probably by getting to a high place and picking off enemies one by one with a sniper rifle. The campaign in this game is a must.The co-op is OK. It's not amazing, and I was disappointed that the co-op wasn't really open world like the single player campaign. You can play with up to four people, but you don't get all the abilities you have in the single player. One of the most fun parts of the co-op are the competitions. In each mission there is a part were all players are competing for the highest score. There are jet ski challenges, sniper challenges, bow challenges, RPG challenges, and more.The multiplayer was surprisingly fun. Most games like this that aren't built with a multiplayer focus are not very good. I find this one to be enjoyable. However, there are only a couple hundred people who play regularly, so you cannot play most game modes.There are some things in this game that just make you go "What?" Because as realistic as it seems most of the time, sometimes there are just crazy things. I won't tell you any so it's not spoiled, but be prepared for some crazy stuff.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Its really good. Almost great. I'll just leave a list of positives and negatives.+FOV slider* (see negatives)+Lots of guns and customization of weapons. +The game encourages creative combat and gives you plenty of tools to do as you wish. (I'm a stealth nut and I had a blast clearing areas without being detected.)+The island's characters are fun and memorable.+19 hours to complete the game from start to finish according to steam. I did all of the outposts except for two, all of the towers, and I upgraded my stuff to max by hunting animals. All of which is pretty much mandatory unless you want to make the game extremely difficult.+Graphics are pretty great. Bright and colorful.+Lots of wild animals really bring the world to life.+Vehicles galore. Boats, gunboats, jetskies, handgliders, wingsuit, cars, jeeps, bigass trucks, buggys.-*FOV temporarily zooms back to default during cutscenes and when your character does an action (i.e. opening doors, climbing towers, hacking towers, getting in vehicles, etc.) This caused me a bit of nausea and headache after extended playtime. (It goes back to your FOV setting once the action/cutscene is complete)-I am getting really sick of Ubisoft's trope of climbing a tower and hitting a button to reveal areas of the map. It was cool for the first few Assassin's Creed games as a gimmick, but please stop putting it in every single game you make. ugh.-Jason Brody is the most unlikable protagonist I've ever played as. I seriously hate him and all of his friends. -Story is... I don't want to say bad, but very inconsistant. Sometimes its good, other times its bad. -Music sucks, but thats just my opinion. I actually turned it off. Its either generic bland orchestra, meh tribal, or dubstep. -I hate mandatory side missions. Tower climbing to reveal the map. Hunting to upgrade inventory size, wallet size, weapon slots, etc. And taking down outposts to make it so you're not constantly being attacked at all times every time you step outside (I tried to not do outposts and the constantly being attacked started to drive me nuts, though I will say that I actually enjoyed taking down outposts).Tip: I was getting lots of framerate dips and crashes until I turned down the PostFX setting. Then everything else was pretty much at max and it ran smoothly after that. I don't know what that PostFX setting did that hogged up so much power, but turning it down to low didn't change much visually and greatly increased performance.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												An absolutely beautiful, dark, thrilling, and ocassionally even funny game. Even if Far Cry 3 doesn't do all that much in the 'open world' category, you are, technically free to go wherever and do whatever you choose in any order you choose. The dissapointing thing to someone who might buy this game solely for the open world could be the lack of DIFFERENT things to do. Don't get me wrong, the outposts were never repetitive, and I played my fair share of knife throwing competitions, but I always felt more inclined to continue the story than anything else. However, if you go into Far Cry 3 expecting a great adventure game, you will be very impressed. The story is incredible despite some obvious 'plot twists' and every mechanic in the game from pulling glass out of your arm to piercing an enemies heart with your machete feels epic, intense, and most of all, never boring. I could go on forever and ever, but I'll leave you with this. Far Cry 3 is one of my all time favorite games and I can promise that you will not regret buying it, especially if it's on sale.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												This game is definitely worth playing! It's a bit mature, and has lots of drugs and trippy moments, but it has a really intriguing story, surprisingly good characters, great conflict in the story, awesome gunplay and weapon options, an amazing open world, a good sense of progression as you explore and fight, very nice graphics, very awesome mechanics, and a bit of humor here and there! The villians are hatable to no end, and I love that! My only complaints are the lack of full control customization for PC and the voice quality for characters outside cutscenes can be really bad! I say that this game should be played by anyone who is okay with the mature content and is looking for an open world FPS with a pretty good story sprinkled in! Bruce Willis out of Ten!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
												Far Cry 3 does a lot of things right.Open WorldThe Open World in the game offers a lot of content aside from the main campaign missions.Racing,shooting challenges with various weapons,capturing outposts and hunting animals.There are probably 30-40 hours worth of game play if you want to 100% the game.UplayI didn't have problems with Uplay aside from the occasional failure of the Uplay overlay to connect to the servers.There are fixes for every single problem that you may have regarding Uplay and you can also disable the in-game overlay.Or you can simply use the key that you get when you buy it on Steam and play it on Uplay.There is no reason to not buy this game just because of Uplay.GameplayIn Far Cry 3 most of the time you will kill endless waves of enemies.Which is fun because each mission is unique in it's own way and there are enough weapons to spice things up.When you are not following the campaign missions,you can capture rebel outposts.You can go Rambo style and kill everyone or you can try to do it in a stealthy way without getting detected.Hunting is another important part of the game.Without hunting animals,you can't improve your gear.It will be harder and harder to fight enemies so the game kinda forces you to hunt animals.Hunting for me,got boring fast.Most of your prey will consist of herbivores that will run once they see you,and you need to simply shoot them.Tigers,sharks,bears and so on are much more fun to hunt,but in the later parts of the game you can just snipe them from afar.Driving in this game is very well done and there is a decent variety of vehicles on the island.Storyline(Potential spoilers)Surprinsingly,the plot is the weak part of the game.You play as Jason Brody.An American tourist that spends his vacation on the island with a bunch of his friends and family.But something goes wrong and everyone is captured by Vaas and his pirates.You go from Jason Brody,a young rich American to a killing machine and expert assassin in about 10 minutes.Most of the stuff that happens,doesn't make real sense.The island natives trust you for no reason,Vaas keeps trying to kill you in weird ways only for you to escape over and over and some characters were undeveloped.Vaas,the best character in the game by far gets too little time on your screen but because he is such a good character you don't even notice that.Hoyt,the main villain after you kill Vaas in a weird vision/dream is undeveloped and is outshined by Vaas in every way.It's a shame both villains get to die in dreams/visions.Your allies in the game are not particularly good characters.Only Sam the German stands out but he too gets too little screen time.Your friends are boring and you only get to interact with them when you save them and they don't have anything good to say.Dennis is the friendly NPC that helps you in the tutorial but stays along for the ride until the end of the game.Citra is a decent character but the plot doesn't make sense with her in it.At the end of the game you can choose between two endings.Citra or your friends.Both endings are kinda underwhelming but one of them is particularly bad.TL;DRFar Cry 3 is a great open world FPS,with tons of content,a great villain in Vaas and a weird storyline.

												Far Cry 3 has been a heavy step up from the 2nd on all accounts. The story is engaging, you as a main character go through a heavy metamorphose, there's a big update graphics-wise and the missions have so much variety it keeps things exciting at all times. Shame it's Uplay but other than that I have no remarks. (choose wisely at the end)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												Imagine a water-down GTA experience on an island.  The nice thing this is not 3rd person.  Now is this game fun? Yes but you have to know what to expect.This is essentially a stripped down crafting system from Elder ScrollsA FPS done similar to COD, Battlefield etc but more realism oriented so you can see your feet and arms.  Heck when you cut animals open and take about a 16 oz steak sized piece of meat out your character EVERY TIME says "ugh" as if he wouldn't be desensitized the 100th time no.The game tries this thing called immersion or whatever to give you a sense of urgency to do things; like oh no I'm stuck here on this island with lots of guns and crazy people and animals and I can make drugs WHOA trippy. So here's what I did. I couldn't get over the fact the red bad guy dudes were driving on a road right next to the good guy casual hippy asian people with austrilian accents.  So I stole one of the jeeps and parked it across the road. Mind you this is in the tutorial section of the game where you are supposed to be all serious and low level (there are no levels sorry bad metaphor).  Anyways not a minute later some AI goons drive up and sure enough stop and get out "OH MAN WHA IS dis CAR? Whooo Dare?" in there most awesome Engrish.  So I stabbed them and took their AK-47s. Then it hit me: this is not a survival sandbox open world game on some island. NO. It is a can you figure out how to get rich and powerful like a african or south east asian warlord! Then omg I had so much fun! I started setting up road blocks everywhere and before you knew it crowds of bad guys would show up just so I could get their free stuff! LOOT PINYATA. (I dont know how to do that N with the ~ over it).So yes tho I've clocked a full 3 hours (ok rounding up) this game against AI is amazing.what about the co-op? Is the multiplayer any good? NO. Nobody plays this, its years old and frankly the survival go make a base kill your friends genre is way beyond this. However this is a very mild easy to play semi-story whatever you are the hero kinda guy so you save the day kinda game. I mean who doesnt love that? Ubisoft weekend $5. I mean can you complain bout that? really?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
												Not for the faint hearted or those who prefer to just run into situations guns blazing.This game is a thinking persons game. You need to plan your tactics before entering most situations. Enemies are, mostly, smart and will not stand there for you to shoot them when you are in combat. Add to this an array of weapons big and small that would have John Rambo as excited as a kid in a candy store, an RPG like element which teaches you certain skills for various situations, a stealth system that actually works, and combat that never fails to get your heart pumping, you have a mix of elements that will have you getting really involved in the world.Tactics: You really need to plan your actions in this game. The health system is kind enough to give you a certain amount of survivability, but get caught in the middle of 10 enemies all packing big guns, and you are gonna hit the dirt faster than you can get more than a clip of shots off (and that is on easy mode). This game makes you think, and gives you options for how you take on enemies.Enemies: These guys have their flaws. But mostly they are smart enough to run for cover, aim properly, and use tactics of their own such as attempting to flank you. They tend to hunt you relentlesly if you run away, and will only give up after you have run a certain distance.Weapons: This game gives you an array of weapons that are quite extensive and suited to any tactics you want to use. Most of them come with modifications that will enhance their usefulness. Some weapons become free as you advance in the game. RPG Elements: This is kept somewhat thematic by the fact you are not a trained merc or anything like that. You are a civilian. So you need to learn combat abilities as you go. It uses the idea of you being initiated into the islands tribal warrior class using tattoos that mark your advancement in various areas of combat techniques. This element strongly has you thinking of the way you want to take on your enemies from the first time you get to choose an ability.Stealth: This relies on, mainly, cover. Cover includes the obvious, such as walls, structures, and vehicles. But it also expands to things such as trees, bushes and the like. There are a few stealth based weapons available, meaning that you can really use stealth to your advantage. And There are abilities which allow you to perform stealth takedowns.Combat: Fast paced, explosive and violent. Combat is very well implemented. Even when in combat with small groups of enemies. You will find your adrenaline pumping and your brain working overtime.All these elements need to be experienced to get an understanding of how good they make this game. If you want a game that makes you feel Rambo or Mclain style. This is for you.10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Coming from recently playing Just Cause 2, I didn't expect the length of this campaign. Especially if you take the time to do side quests, DLC missions, and take over all the outposts and radio towers. This game is fantastic. You can run around and go in guns blazing, or you can sneak up and take everyone out quietly with silenced weapons or the bow. However, my favorite way to play is probably by getting to a high place and picking off enemies one by one with a sniper rifle. The campaign in this game is a must.The co-op is OK. It's not amazing, and I was disappointed that the co-op wasn't really open world like the single player campaign. You can play with up to four people, but you don't get all the abilities you have in the single player. One of the most fun parts of the co-op are the competitions. In each mission there is a part were all players are competing for the highest score. There are jet ski challenges, sniper challenges, bow challenges, RPG challenges, and more.The multiplayer was surprisingly fun. Most games like this that aren't built with a multiplayer focus are not very good. I find this one to be enjoyable. However, there are only a couple hundred people who play regularly, so you cannot play most game modes.There are some things in this game that just make you go "What?" Because as realistic as it seems most of the time, sometimes there are just crazy things. I won't tell you any so it's not spoiled, but be prepared for some crazy stuff.

												I love open world games and having choices.  This game is awesome!  I love the ability to spec out your guy according to your killing style.  The ability to fly a glider, ride a boat or drive a car is also great.  The choice of weapons is pretty good.  Personally I would like to see more options for them.  Before I was halfway through the game I had the choice of pretty much every weapon.. so maybe spread out the rewards a tad more to give you something to work for.  Worth $30 bucks.  And I plan on replaying it again.  The Uplay thing, although annoying isn't that big of a deal unless you got something to hide.  One last issue I had was the boat mission where you HAVE TO BE STEALTH, and at the moment I just wanted to run and gun...Take care and happy hunting.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												An absolutely beautiful, dark, thrilling, and ocassionally even funny game. Even if Far Cry 3 doesn't do all that much in the 'open world' category, you are, technically free to go wherever and do whatever you choose in any order you choose. The dissapointing thing to someone who might buy this game solely for the open world could be the lack of DIFFERENT things to do. Don't get me wrong, the outposts were never repetitive, and I played my fair share of knife throwing competitions, but I always felt more inclined to continue the story than anything else. However, if you go into Far Cry 3 expecting a great adventure game, you will be very impressed. The story is incredible despite some obvious 'plot twists' and every mechanic in the game from pulling glass out of your arm to piercing an enemies heart with your machete feels epic, intense, and most of all, never boring. I could go on forever and ever, but I'll leave you with this. Far Cry 3 is one of my all time favorite games and I can promise that you will not regret buying it, especially if it's on sale.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												This game is definitely worth playing! It's a bit mature, and has lots of drugs and trippy moments, but it has a really intriguing story, surprisingly good characters, great conflict in the story, awesome gunplay and weapon options, an amazing open world, a good sense of progression as you explore and fight, very nice graphics, very awesome mechanics, and a bit of humor here and there! The villians are hatable to no end, and I love that! My only complaints are the lack of full control customization for PC and the voice quality for characters outside cutscenes can be really bad! I say that this game should be played by anyone who is okay with the mature content and is looking for an open world FPS with a pretty good story sprinkled in! Bruce Willis out of Ten!

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												Singleplayer is brilliant, the storyline is full of suspense and great acting, along with brilliant cutscenes and characters.The graphics are literally 2nd to none, whilst the gameplay itself is engaging and satisfying; pummelling baddies with a machete, or laying down a fusilade with a PKM only to watch a Tiger burst out and maul your opponents is simply brilliant, it's random events like this that makes Far Cry 3 unique to other sandbox games.The multiplayer is decent, but other than the victorious team's MVP using a finishing move after they win a round; it doesn't really bring anything new to the FPS multiplayer table. Saying that it isn't bad either! Just don't go expecting a level of depth that equals Battlefield.Overall, I'd say, if you're bored of your collection of games and have a few coins jingling about in your virtual wallet. Go get. You won't regret it!
